title: [Large-scale] Integrated Language Education Framework for Multilingual Learners in Social Studies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Social Studies Concepts in Secondary Education and Basic Academic Writing Skills
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environment integrating social studies content with academic language development. Diverse native language backgrounds among learners and digital resource utilization in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) setting

learning_goals: Participants can apply academic language functions (comparison, argumentation, summarization) with 80% accuracy when analyzing social studies texts.
Participants can set three or more personalized language goals through self-assessment based on the WIDA language development scale.

Learners can form multilingual teams (Korean, English, Japanese speakers) to collaboratively write three 5-page analysis reports on global social issues (e.g., climate change, aging population, AI ethics), clearly defining roles (research, writing, review) and submitting final reports within two weeks.

Learners can structure a 10-minute presentation using academic language strategies (specialized terminology, logical structuring, evidence-based arguments), achieving 4+ points on a 5-point peer review rubric (clarity, logic, professionalism).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
